column1: How did you first learn of Homestuck?
I had a dream abt the plot of the first 4 acts and decided to read it to check if my dream was canonically accurate (it was)
I was reading problem sleuth before it started

saw pictures of nepeta everywhere on the internet, the last straw was when I searched up "Cat hacks"(lemon demon's song) on google and there was a picture of nepeta, so I found which comic she was in and got invested
A friend on a website called TinierMe. She had Gamzee as her profile background
Gmod Workshop Addon for Garry's Mod
My sister played Nepetas theme at me then dunked me head first into this hell hole
i knew of itt from random musings on youtube but when i saw the doritos and fritos fan animation it really started the downward spiral.
It was all over the internet and my school when I was 12, and I was an avid hater at its peak popularity because I'm a contrarian (I was wrong).
okay it was just youtube but i want you to know it was specifically mambostuck. i dont even like kpop idk how that ended up in my reccomendations
vaguely knew it existed never had the desire to read it until I was 13 but I lost interest halfway through then finished it during lockdown
My younger brother (younger by one minute, that is)

I remember this guy (who is now retired from yt) who used to make "Reacting to cringe sans fangirls!1!1" between 2018-2019 and he mentioned vriska a bunch of times. I didn't know anything ab hs until 2020 by a friend from an ex-friend on discord.
roblox LOL it was a rhythm game and i heard black n thought it was cool
Through hearing the OST in a Roblox game. Yes, that is legitimately why I got into Homestuck.
Ryan North's Dinosaur Comic's News section
stumbled upon it on the internet
I found one of the books in a library.
I was looking something up on google and homestuck was a popular search tag after I typed "home" and I checked it out
Saw edit on tumblr, didn't discover properly until I saw it on youtube
Weird shit, someone etched Karkats name into the side of a wall in my hometown, one thing led to another
Some I can haz cheeseburger meme site back in the day
searched up “Toby fox irl” and saw that pic of him next to the redglare cosplayer
I've been following Hussie's work since well before the original MSPA forum thread
Found the Act with Alterniabound and played the game in the early 2010s. Got interested from there and learned more about the series.
My friend compared the first time they heard my voice to a Karkat comic dub.
I literally have no idea. Prior to reading it Homestuck had just sort of existed in my brain as "oh that webcomic that exists."
That shitty news feed the mobile google app (not chrome, google) used to have
My brother, technically i joined the fandom when i was a child bc of him but i never actually read it until 2022 i believe.
Kept seeing fanart heard of it in passing and gave it a chance
i asked a dude about his cosplay at a con and he went all "let me tell you about homestuck" on me

i at first learned about it through undertale when i was 10 and tried to read it but i never got past act 2. i revisited it around late 2023 because i had a friend that liked it and it seemed cool, so i guess you could call it a mix of t and h
My mother had me read it
Got into MSPA via Problem Sleuth, was there when `Stuck launched. So TECHNICALLY another webcomic, only... not?
Unfriendable. Screenshot of a tumblr post about karkat.
My older sister was a homestuck fan back in 2014-2016 at its peak and she got me into it by accident by getting you can’t fight the homestuck stuck in my head for 8 years .
I came across broadway homestuck on spotify and searched up homestuck
TV Tropes during the Undertale phase
I remember discovering the webcomic thanks to Garry's Mod. It's kind of funny.
Technically twitter but i basically started reading it because a friend was reading it and i wanted to finish it before them teehee yes this was important enough to mark as other.
iFunny. i wish i was joking
A player in TF2 server was spamming Vriska tags, I was immediately captured
I had a sibling who was into it (I didn't read it for years out of spite)

when i was younger listening to spotify on shuffle, karkalicious (broadway hs) used to constantly play and i really liked it,, then when looking back at my old music taste i found it again and found out abt the webcomic!!
How could you not know about homestuck growing up in the early 2010s
"Posmotre", which is the russian TVTropes analogue
found karkat on google images and then learned what homestuck was when i was like 9
it was on after problem sleuth
rivals of aether john egbert mod
I don't think I heard it anywhere specifically. I was just aware of it by extension of it being an internet urban legend.
will be so real, i do not remember
a roblox game called robeats (i wish i was joking)

ive always known about homestuck because of the… odd past surrounding it(specifically with cosplayers in conventions and such), i just never knew what it was about and whenever i asked i never got a straight answer so i just decided to read it for myself to see what the hype was about, oh what a horrible mistake that was.
brother told me about it (and wouldnt stop loudly reading it which made me curious)
I was looking at fanfics and saw someone talking about homestuck mary sues
umm technically im not in the fandom im just really curious
Starmen.net "radiation is involved in this big EB fancomic"
This one time at bible camp someone told me about it
...I got into it because a guy I likes asked me to. We're now on year 11 of our marriage so I guess it was worth it

when i was like little i watched jacksepticeye play hiveswap and then got my dad to pirate it for me, i had no idea what homestuck was at the time :p thats on a technicality though, i joined the fandom because of a dsmp x homestuck fanart thing.....
randomly came across it as a kid, forgot about it for years and suddenly re-remembered it existed
it was many years ago and i do not remember!
My friends started reading it for no reason
my cousins told me about it like 6 years ago when i was talking about undertale
smash Bros brawl -> mother 3 -> earthbound -> Halloween hack -> megalovania -> vriska -> homestuck
my sister showed it to me
Some character in a game (i cant remember) was based off of jake english which got me into homestuck
found a link on a youtubers website
i was in another fandom at the time and many fans in that fandom references and talked about Homestuck
I dont know how but one day i typed it in the searchbar randomly. i remember the day, there wasn't a reason
Found the physical book in a book store
A game on roblox "Adventure Forward 2: Star Saviour" had used parts of homestuck in its stage music, introducing me to the series.
Google Image Search when trying to look up Nordic troll art.
By waiting for it after reading Problem Sleuth
My brother made me read it
talking to cosplayers of other fandoms at a con
I remembered my english teacher did her thesis on homestuck and at a point at 3am I decided to read.
The YouTuber Mark maker in 2020 or 2019

I heard a girl I liked at school was reading this new comic back in the day where it was like a text adventure game and you could help choose the story and I was sold immediately. It happened to be on my birthday to!
Izzyzz's video on the sharpie bath incident

I’ve always known about Homestuck and the date April 13th via internet cultural osmosis, and one day I realized it was Homestuck Day and I decided to read the entire comic as a bit. It is no longer a bit.
I’ve known about it for quite awhile but never really tried reading it until a decade later I accidentally got myself addicted to it.
Some girls on my school bus mentioned it once. All downhill from there.
Little Big Planet 2 for the playstation 3
I was online and someone called me then killed themselves but they had a homestuck pfp so I started reading it ig, kinda a wild way to get into a fandom now I think about it
Musically. Specifically the davekat video game lover video.
Knew it was "popular" and just wanted to find out why
Heard a lot while growing up on my side of the internet
I saw a image on a roblox t-shirt of nepeta in a suit and I found it so cute I image searched who it was and I got into homestuck
A forum I was on at the time

I was reading Problem Sleuth when it was wrapping up, so I naturally stuck around for the next thing. But to find MSPA, I'm not totally sure, I know my sister found it first. I think it was either linked on XKCD or JayIsGames?
getting bullied by a sollux on roblox LMAFO
i believe it was through google related image search? either that or youtube, not sure
when it kept getting made fun of in like 2015 on forums
A stranger in a comics and games store
A world of warcraft forum game/adventure mentioned Problem Sleuth, which then led to homestuck
its one of those things you'll know growing up on the internet just because everyone else did
randomly stumbled upon it one day
people kept putting it in their pokefarm bios
I got one of the comics on my birthday as a gift.
The MS Paint Adventures site itself
Article on the Escapist about the "Homestuck is my favorite anime' meme going around at the time
A now nonexistent diaries site BeOn
hardcore deltarune fan desperately searching for more things like it
I saw people cosplaying in 2015 and asked them about it.
The music (someone playing Midnight Crew Drawing Dead in a Team Fortress 2 match)
this falls under youtube but i found sbahj lets read by TheStolkien in like 2019 before i knew what the hell a sburb was. i was like nine years old lol
I knew of its existence as a "a terrible thing that exists" like el dorado or a slumbering lovecraftian horror. I almost always knew it existed, but it was always at the corner of my eye.
I found out about it from TVTropes.com
podcast. also you have facebook listed twice
Was already a fan of Andrew before Homestuck
I was on minecraft doing parkour in a server lobby and someone asked me if my username was i spired by spades slick from homestuck. I had no idea what the fuck homestuck was at the time.
My 13 year old sibling read it to me. I was 8 and don't remember the exact date
it has been a consistent part of the internet for like 15 years so
I’m Dave strider and I twerk for Jesus
i genuinely do not remember, i think it got beamed into my head by aliens.
at a con i saw a kanaya cosplayer and i thought she was hot so i asked her what her cosplay was from
“I’m Dave strider and I twerk for Jesus's”
always knew of it, decided to finally read it to see if it was actually good
Best 404 Page ever played the Mambostuck animation.
Heard about it online a few times and a classmate mentioned it, but I knew it was long so only started reading because I was bored during quarantine
I went to a con sometime 2013/2014 ish, and it was a bit after Cascade, and someone at the Con mentioned it so I checked it out.
Ass Pancakes, the TF2 Freak that uses the Warhammer of Zillyhoo.
Started with Problem Sleuth and don't remember how I found it
Found the Homestuck Hardcover in my older sibling's room
Complete random chance. Fairly sure it was just a google link.
I stumbled upon the comic I like web comics a looot
My sister! she was a big homestuck fan in 2016, and I've been interested since i saw her reading it!
I saw a Karkat drawing at school and remembered Homestuck is a thing and felt inspired to read it. I don't know how it spawned in my head before that.

A combination of other webcomic and toby. I like comics and I liked Undertale, plus Earthbound is my favorite game (so I liked the sound of the name "Homestuck"), so I heard about it and it was downhill from there
heard tobyfox made music for it idk
amino. undertale one specifically. not sure what that is categorized as (dont think i knew toby fox was involved)
Ive been online for a while so I’ve always known it existed, I’m just getting into it now
I Suddenly Remembered That It Existed
Initially heard of it on tumblr, started it due to friend recommendation.
KnowYourMeme.com (stumbled on to the homestuck article in 2014)
Seeing trolls at comicon and wanting to see what it was from :)
I had heard of it a long time before I read it. There was a time when hearing about it was nearly unavoidable in certain spaces, so I'd say "General Internet Buzz".
You can’t really not know about homestuck in this interweb ecosystem…
Jacksepticeye Played It Im Pretty Sure And From Their Heck Broke Loose
Old now extinct art based social media app drawcast
Homestuck music was used in a roblox game I liked called “Adventure Forward”, and I wanted to know the origins of the music.
awuaintence drawing famart in my sketchbook and writing the weblink

I looked up “good webcomics” and found it on a list
My mother got me into it

On KIK (a messenger app at the time now its a porn app lol)
i wanted to get into it cus idk
amino when i was 9.. throws up everywher
idk why i was just doing smth and homestuck popped into my head like a sleeper agent
Screenshots of tumblr posts on Pinterest

My dad told me to read it
My Dad Made my Club Penguin & Minecraft username Mr_Egbert. It wasn't long after someone said "Oh! Like Homstuck?" And the rest was history
I was reading Problem Slueth. Then it ended. Then Homestuck began. This can't possibly be so uncommon as to not be an option here, can it?
YouTube! Specifically I got recommended the Voxus fandub
ancient meme websites lost to the sands of time.
a post in argentinian social media called taringa
The hordes of homestuck cosplayers at conventions
my babysitter accidentally mentioned it once
background music in a tf2 video
finding the artstyle interesting so i tried to look for it through google image search

Learned of it via the music (heir of grief, atomic bonsai and others) in video game
i couldn't...i couldn't even begin to tell you honestly.
My art teacher said I'd like it. I did.
Friends on an old defunct art website (also stumbled into it a few times when I was looking for new webcomics)
My sister, youtube (last time i remember were the fruit rumpus, popular convention videos, listening to extended homestuck music n' more)
so I knew of homestuck from megalovania but i got into homestuck while i did a school work program and my boss was a homestuck fan who convinced me to read it
MY STEP BROTHER + GOOGLE PLUS when it was still around

i saw its name in my dream

comic con infamy as well as youtube song gold pilot
seeing it over the internet since 2015/curiosity
